intro: Saurauia postarii, commonly known as the Sierra Leone starwood, is a member of the Ericaceae family, native to the tropical rainforests of West Africa. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Saurauia postarii thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
